args:
The Doctor's plan is to summon forth a fiend
called Aspidochelone from the space between
worlds and let it run roughshod across the
entire world. So the prince and his friends set
out to slay a manticore, which possesses the
power to create tears in space.
Getting away? My dear Prince, I have been\nwaiting for you.
After all, it would be most efficient if you\nwould cooperate with my experiment.
You must not have heard my first answer.\nI won't be party to a heartless experiment\nthat brings suffering to people!
And what if I told you we could reduce\nthat suffering if you but lent your aid?
Did the rubbish not inform you\nof my area of expertise?
Hey, are you talking about ME?!
My field involves the fusion of human and\nfiend. More specifically, I conduct research\ninto their particular powers.
My research has produced fine results—\nthe fact that rubbish can still control a\ndragon's power is proof of such.
You sure talk a lot for a guy who doesn't\nactually say much of anything.
Then let me speak plain, my friend:\nThrough the fusion of human and fiend,\nwe can control the power of said fiends.

Aspidochelone is a more powerful fiend,
but the theory is essentially the same.
By fusing it with a person, it becomes
possible to control its power.
Wait, hold the hell up. So when ya say ya\nwant the boss's help, what yer ACTUALLY\nsayin' is that ya want him to...
Exactly. I want to fuse the prince\nwith Aspidochelone.
If we succeed, people will no longer\nhave need to fear the fiend.
We would never let you carry out such\na profane act upon His Highness!
Just so. He is our leader and friend,\nand we will not allow him to fall prey\nto your unhinged whims.
Then what WILL you do? Aspidochelone\nis like a natural disaster—dialogue and\npersuasion will be of no avail on it.
If it is not brought to heel somehow,\nit will simply overrun the world.
I have one question, Doctor: Why me?
I am no mad scientist who seeks only to\nsow chaos and dread. If there is a way\nto minimize suffering, I am for it.
What I wish from Aspidochelone is not\ndestruction, but to harness its capacity\nto serve as a body of stored knowledge.
In order to do that, it must be controlled\nby a central figure—a task which is far\nbeyond the ken of a normal human.
But you, Prince! You have potential!\nYour dragonblood and shapeshifting\nabilities are beyond any normal man!
You can become an eternal tome—a\nrecord of our world's very existence.\nSurely you see this for the honor it is!
Dude, we are NOT letting you turn\nthe prince into a book!
No matter how vast the knowledge to\nbe gained, it is not worth the sacrifice.
And may I take the thoughts of your\ncompanions to be your own will\nin this matter, Prince?

You can. I would never help a group
that willingly calls itself evil and seems
to think nothing of causing pain while
paying lip service to its prevention.
Ah, you fail to understand me after all.\n＂Evil＂ is the very thing that will progress\nthe world to its next evolution.

Alas, I see I am left with no other option.
If you are not willing to help me in this,
I will have to compel your cooperation.
...Come forth, manticore!
It tore a hole in space!
Does that hole lead to the space between\nworlds?!
Behold the technological power\nof the Syndicate, my new friends!
This manticore is a specialized fiend\ncreated by our group that has the\npower to warp space itself!
We will widen the tear and beckon\nAspidochelone forth, at which point\nit will run rampant across the world.

You seem to think yourself a good man,
Prince. Would a good man not offer
himself up at this point to prevent the
inevitable carnage to come?
We already told you no, man!\nLike, a BUNCH of times!
If you're seriously considering this,\nyou're a bigger idiot than I thought.
There's a real simple option here:\nKill the manticore.
I always hope to see intelligence in\npeople—including my enemies.
Yeah, we're more of the ＂hit the big\nthing till it stops movin'＂ sorta crowd.
Please do not paint all of us\nwith that same brush, Ranzal.
That being said, there ARE times when\na simplistic methodology is actually\nthe most effective.
A fair point. But the question remains:\nCAN you defeat my manticore?
And then we're coming for you, Doctor.\nSo if you got any big plans coming up,\nI suggest you cancel 'em!
